{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine the most posteriorly present foramen in the base of the skull, we need to analyze the information provided in the relevant documents. The posterior part of the base of the skull extends from the anterior edge of the foramen magnum posteriorly to the superior nuchal lines. The occipital bone is the major bony element of this part of the base of the skull. The foramen magnum is located in the most inferior portion of the cranial fossa as a part of the occipital bone. The foramen rotundum is located in the middle cranial fossa, while the foramen ovale is located in the posterior half of the middle part of the base of the skull. The foramen spinosum is also located in the middle cranial fossa. Based on this information, the most posteriorly present foramen in the base of the skull is the foramen magnum. Therefore, the answer is D. All at same level.", "answer_choice": "D"}
